instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.USBC_XA_CC2: What is USBC_XA_CC2? USBC_XA_CC2 is a line between the USB-C muxing chip such as the CD3217 or CD3215 and the USB-C charger. Communication must happen on this line in order for the USB-C charger to put out 20v..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Hi,
I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that has no power. I tried a new USB-C cable, but no success. The ampmeter stays black, and on F3050 I get 0V.
on F3050 i get 0.187V in diode mode.
Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground at CC1/2 lines.
<CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> is the first suspect here.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>USBC_XA_CC1</SIGNAL> = 0.044V
<SIGNAL>USBC_XA_CC2</SIGNAL> = 0.007V

It seams shorted.

Shall i replace <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
